葡葡RSgrapes, Portugal
  • fruit of a plant 艹 harvested 匍 for wine; country known for it's fine wines
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 匍 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
葡萄 [ pú tao ]: grape
葡萄干 [ pú tao gān ]: raisin; dried grape
葡萄园 [ pú táo yuán ]: vineyard
葡萄柚 [ pú táo yòu ]: grapefruit
葡萄汁 [ pú táo zhī ]: grape juice

heisig_chinese_memo: Grapes (A) are totally a conspiracy, I'm telling you. They're pretty little plants with flowers that grow in clusters, and they are sweet, I know, but...Bound up in each little grape (the skin is like a wrapping) is a tiny RFID tag that the government uses to spy on you. That's why they sell them in such large quantities for so cheap - if you "pass" a few of them out, no matter - odds are that at least one will stay inside you. They especially push them on kids.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the crawling (匍) grass (艹) is a grape
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Grapes (A) are totally a conspiracy, I'm telling you. They're pretty little plants with flowers that grow in clusters, and they are sweet, I know, but...Bound up in each little grape (the skin is like a wrapping) is a tiny RFID tag that the government uses to spy on you. That's why they sell them in such large quantities for so cheap - if you "pass" a few of them out, no matter - odds are that at least one will stay inside you. They especially push them on kids.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸", " creeping " sound. "Grape" is a vine plant, and is also called "pupu", "putao", "syzygium", etc. The fruit is also called grape and can be used to make wine. According to "Historical Records", grapes were introduced to China when Zhang Qian was an envoy to the Western Regions during Emperor Wu of the Western Han Dynasty. "Historical Records. "Biography of Dawan": "Wan Zuo Zuo uses Putao as wine, and the rich store up to ten thousand stones, and the longest are undefeated for decades. The vulgar is addicted to wine, and horses are addicted to alfalfa. Pu Tao is fertile and fertile." "Emperor Xiaowu of the Former Han Dynasty": "The era of Xiaowu...the world is rich and rich, with more financial resources, and the horses and horses are strong. Therefore, they can accumulate goods....speaking of Tianma and grapes, you will pass Dawan and rest in peace."

An example in the ancient book is the Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Yan Ge Xing": "A cup of grapes is drunk for a thousand days, and there is nothing wrong with the nine transfer gods." Another example is the Tang Dynasty Wang Han's "Liangzhou Ci": "Grape wine luminous cup, if you want to drink Pipa immediately ."
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", " creeping " sound. "Grapes" are vines, which were introduced to China when Zhang Qian was an envoy to the Western Regions during Emperor Wu of the Western Han Dynasty.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「匍」聲。「葡萄」是藤本植物，又作「蒲萄」、「蒲陶」、「蒲桃」等，其果實亦稱為葡萄，可釀酒。據《史記》，葡萄是西漢武帝年間張騫出使西域時傳入中國。《史記．大宛列傳》：「宛左右以蒲陶為酒，富人藏酒至萬餘石，久者數十歲不敗。俗嗜酒，馬嗜苜蓿。漢使取其實來，於是天子始種苜蓿、蒲陶肥饒地。」《前漢紀．前漢孝武皇帝紀》：「孝武之世……天下殷富，財力有餘，士馬強盛。故能積群貨。……聞天馬、葡萄則通大宛、安息。」

　　古書中的例子如北周庾信〈燕歌行〉：「葡萄一杯千日醉，無事九轉學神仙。」又如唐代王翰〈涼州詞〉：「葡萄美酒夜光杯，欲飲琵琶馬上催。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「匍」聲。「葡萄」是藤本植物，乃西漢武帝年間張騫出使西域時傳入中國。

Chinese: Grapes (A) are totally a conspiracy, I'm telling you. They're pretty little plants with flowers that grow in clusters, and they are sweet, I know, but...Bound up in each little grape (the skin is like a wrapping) is a tiny RFID tag that the government uses to spy on you. That's why they sell them in such large quantities for so cheap - if you "pass" a few of them out, no matter - odds are that at least one will stay inside you. They especially push them on kids.
Meaning: grapes (a)

That's why they sell them in such large quantities for so cheap - if you "pass" a few of them out, no matter - odds are that at least one will stay inside you. They especially push them on kids.
Kind: both

從「 艸 」，「 匍 」聲。「葡萄」是藤本植物，又作「蒲萄」、「蒲陶」、「蒲桃」等，其果實亦稱為葡萄，可釀酒。據《史記》，葡萄是西漢武帝年間張騫出使西域時傳入中國。《史記．大宛列傳》：「宛左右以蒲陶為酒，富人藏酒至萬餘石，久者數十歲不敗。俗嗜酒，馬嗜苜蓿。漢使取其實來，於是天子始種苜蓿、蒲陶肥饒地。」《前漢紀．前漢孝武皇帝紀》：「孝武之世……天下殷富，財力有餘，士馬強盛。故能積群貨。……聞天馬、葡萄則通大宛、安息。」 古書中的例子如北周庾信〈燕歌行〉：「葡萄一杯千日醉，無事九轉學神仙。」又如唐代王翰〈涼州詞〉：「葡萄美酒夜光杯，欲飲琵琶馬上催。」
From " 艸", " creeping" sound. "Grape" is a vine plant, and is also called "pupu", "putao", "syzygium", etc. The fruit is also called grape and can be used to make wine. According to "Historical Records", grapes were introduced to China when Zhang Qian was an envoy to the Western Regions during Emperor Wu of the Western Han Dynasty. "Historical Records. "Biography of Dawan": "Wan Zuo Zuo uses Putao as wine, and the rich store up to ten thousand stones, and the longest are undefeated for decades. The vulgar is addicted to wine, and horses are addicted to alfalfa. Pu Tao is fertile and fertile." "Emperor Xiaowu of the Former Han Dynasty": "The era of Xiaowu...the world is rich and rich, with more financial resources, and the horses and horses are strong. Therefore, they can accumulate goods....speaking of Tianma and grapes, you will pass Dawan and rest in peace." An example in the ancient book is the Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Yan Ge Xing": "A cup of grapes is drunk for a thousand days, and there is nothing wrong with the nine transfer gods." Another example is the Tang Dynasty Wang Han's "Liangzhou Ci": "Grape wine luminous cup, if you want to drink Pipa immediately ."

葡字的基本解释

葡
pú
〔葡萄〕ａ．落叶藤本植物，果实圆形或椭圆形，味甜可食，亦可酿酒；ｂ．这种植物的果实或像其形者，如“葡葡干”。“葡葡酒”。“葡葡球菌”。

葡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pú］
［《篇海》蒲胡切］
见“葡萄”。

葡字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　葡； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1045第20
【篇海】薄胡切，音蒲。俗借葡爲蒲陶字。　又【集韻】平祕切，音備。隷作。凡備、糒字从此。

葡字的源字形

葡字的起名意思

葡萄，落叶藤本植物。

Portuguese
pú
[Grapes] a. Deciduous vines, round or oval fruit, sweet and edible, and can also be used for making wine; b. The fruit of this plant may resemble its shape, such as "Portuguese dried grapes." "Portuguese wine". "Staphylococcus".

【Pianhai】Bo Huqie, Yinpu. Commonly borrowed Portuguese as the word for Pu Tao.　[Jiyun] Ping and secret, sound preparation. Li Zuo. Fanbei, 糒字 from now on.

Name meaning
Grapes, deciduous vines.
葡
形声字。艸(+)表意,其古文字形体像草,表示与植物有关;匍(pa)表声,匍有爬义,表示葡萄是蔓生攀爬植物。本义
是葡萄。
[葡萄]①落叶藤本植物,果实成串,汁多、味酸甜,是常
见的水果,也是酿酒的原料。2这种植物的果实。
~萄 ~萄酒~萄糖 ~萄紫
pú
葡。

隶
楷
португальский
Пиктофонетические символы.
(+) Означает, что его древние символы напоминают траву, указывая на то, что он связан с растениями; 匍 (па) означает, что он имеет ползучий смысл, указывая на то, что виноград является ползучим вьющимся растением.
Первоначальное значение - виноград.
[Виноград] ① Листопадные лозы, гроздья фруктов, сочные, кисло-сладкие, являются обычными фруктами и сырьем для виноделия.
2 Плод этого растения.
~ Виноград ~ вино ~ глюкоза ~ фиолетовый
